title: Drawing
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. The scheme and decoration are variations of 1938-88-1912. Cornucopias crowned by flames crossing behind the escutcheon. The crossing point of the branches is surrounded by a wreath. At left, only partly visible, are fasces and the military flail, at right colors. Dark background.
